Class FormatText

java.lang.Object
us.stomberg.solarsystemsim.graphics.FormatText
public class FormatText extends Object
Class to store methods dealing with text and strings to be displayed on screen.

  • Method Details

    • drawText

      public static void drawText(Graphics2D g, ArrayList<String> text, int x, int y, double lineSpacing)
      Prints an array of lines of text onto the screen. Each String in the array is treated as a line, and the positioning is determined by the line spacing and base x and y positions.
      Parameters:
      g - current Graphics2D object
      text - array of lines of text to print
      x - x position of upper-left corner
      y - y position of upper-left corner
      lineSpacing - distance between lines measured in character heights

    • drawText

      public static void drawText(Graphics2D g, String text, int x, int y)

    • formatDuration

      public static String formatDuration(long amount, TemporalUnit unit)
      Formats a time duration into a readable string. Formats milliseconds into years, days, hours, minutes, seconds, and the remainder milliseconds.
      Returns:
      Returns the formatted string.

    • formatValue

      public static String formatValue(double num, String unit, String kiloUnit)
      Formats a large number to be more readable. Groups the zeroes if possible, and appends the correct unit. If value is over 10000, will use the kilo unit and divide the value by 1000. (eg. 10000000 -> 10,000km)
      Parameters:
      num - number to format
      unit - base unit
      kiloUnit - unit 1000x base unit
      Returns:
      Returns the formatted string.

    • formatScale

      public static String formatScale(Double num, boolean round)
      Formats a large number to be more readable. Groups the zeroes if possible, and appends the correct unit. If value is over 10000, will use the kilo unit and divide the value by 1000. (eg. 10000000 -> 10,000km)
      Parameters:
      num - number to format
      Returns:
      Returns the formatted string.
